articles.author: COLLEEN LONG
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden is commuting the sentences of roughly 1,500 people who were released from prison and placed on home confinement during the coronavirus pandemic and is pardoning 39 Americans convicted of nonviolent crimes.
articles.title: Biden commutes roughly 1,500 sentences and pardons 39 people in biggest single-day act of clemency

articles.author: ERIC TUCKER and ALANNA DURKIN RICHER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The FBI should have done more to gather intelligence before the Capitol riot, according to a watchdog report Thursday that also said no undercover FBI employees were on the scene on Jan.
articles.title: Watchdog finds FBI intelligence missteps before Jan. 6 riot, but no undercover agents were present

articles.author: PATRICK WHITTLE
articles.description: PORTLAND, Maine (AP) — The incoming administration of President-elect Donald Trump is likely to bring big changes for one of the oldest sectors of the U.S. economy — seafood — and some in the industry believe the returning president will be more responsive to its needs.
articles.title: Some in seafood industry see Trump as fishermen's friend, but tariffs could make for pricier fish

articles.author: LEA SKENE and JENNIFER SINCO KELLEHER
articles.description: After Luigi Mangione made the difficult decision to undergo spinal surgery last year for chronic back pain, he became a proponent of the procedure that changed his life for the better.
articles.title: Back trouble and brain fog bothered suspect in UnitedHealthcare CEO killing, his posts show

articles.author: ILLIA NOVIKOV
articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Russia launched a massive aerial attack against Ukraine on Friday, firing 93 missiles and almost 200 drones, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, describing it as one of the heaviest bombardments of the country's energy sector since Russia's full-scale invasion almost three years ago.
articles.title: Russia targets Ukrainian infrastructure with a massive attack of cruise missiles and drones

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken is pressing ahead with efforts to unify Middle East nations in support of a peaceful political transition in Syria.He is meeting on Friday with Turkey's foreign minister after talks with President Recep Tayyip Erdogan to try to bring Turkey into a consensus to prevent Syria from collapsing into wider turmoil.
articles.title: Middle East latest: Blinken urges Mideast nations to support a peaceful Syrian political transition

articles.author: DIDI TANG
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Chinese leader Xi Jinping would likely see President-elect Donald Trump’s invitation to attend his inauguration as too risky to accept, and the gesture from Trump may have little bearing on the increasingly competitive ties between the two nations as the White House changes hands, experts say.
articles.title: China's Xi is likely to decline Trump's inauguration invitation, seeing it as too risky to attend

articles.author: JILL COLVIN
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Donald Trump was on the verge of backing a 16-week federal abortion ban earlier this year when aides staged an intervention.
articles.title: Highlights from Trump's interview with Time magazine

articles.author: MARTHA BELLISLE
articles.description: The U.S. Olympic & Paralympic Committee placed an employee on administrative leave Thursday after The Associated Press reported that one of its coaches was accused of sexually abusing a young biathlete, causing her so much distress that she attempted suicide.
articles.title: US Olympic and Paralympic officials put coach on leave after AP reports sexual abuse allegations

articles.author: DAVID KOENIG
articles.description: Drones for commercial and recreational use have grown rapidly in popularity, despite restrictions on who can operate them and where they can be flown.No-fly zones are enforced around airports, military installations, nuclear plants, certain landmarks including the Statue of Liberty, and sports stadiums during games.
articles.title: Drone operators worry that anxiety over mystery sightings will lead to new restrictions
